website_summaries.verdict: This set takes your regular hiking boots and makes them more user friendly for snow or mud.
pros: Lower profile than some others available, but keeps snow, rocks, and debris from getting into the top of your boots
Also works well in areas where you are trying to avoid mosquito bites
Comes with a compact carry bag that is easy to pack
Protects the bottom of your pants from getting wet
Easy to walk or hike while wearing
cons: This set comes only in a "one-size-fits-all."
They may seem a little short for some users, but are still effective in keeping debris and snow out of your shoes

customer_reviews.title: Protect your ankles and block debris
customer_reviews.text: Good low waterproof gaiters to protect laces, ankles, and prevent debris from getting into boots. After getting the first one I bought a 2nd to offer a hiking guest when needed. Nice nylon bag and fits in a pack or bag (compresses very small). Sometimes you don't need high gaiters (when I wear shorts) and these fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: S.T.

customer_reviews.title: Great gaiters
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a trip up Mount St Helens and they worked great ! I ended the hike with only a little ash and one small rock in my shoes, these worked like a charm. I will use these this winter also, great short gaiters
customer_reviews.author: K Wright

customer_reviews.title: Works great for first time backpacking or budgeting!
customer_reviews.text: These gaiters were great! I just finished a 3 day backpacking trip and they held their own. It kept the dust and debris out of my shoe. They were easy to put on and adjust! They fit great! I did not get to try out the waterproofing sadly so i can not speak on account of that. But i would definitly buy another pair when these wear out and definitly be getting my girlfriend a pair as well
customer_reviews.author: Julio

customer_reviews.title: Very short
customer_reviews.text: These are well enough made for the price but are too short to gator between pants and shoes. They work well to keep debris out of my shoes, though.
customer_reviews.author: D Langsam

customer_reviews.title: They work well
customer_reviews.text: Very warm, to uncomfortable levels actually. However, they work very well to keep out the sawdust that I'm knee deep in on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: HaulinAuss

customer_reviews.title: That it works
customer_reviews.text: These are great when you are hiking and you don't want the dust to get in your boots and it repeals water when raining.
customer_reviews.author: Janice T. Rensch

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: these were cheap and probably won't last long. Given the price, they are almost disposable.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Child-sized
customer_reviews.text: These things are about half the size of what’s displayed in the picture. That must be a kid’s boot. I wouldn’t think these would be very useful for anything bigger than a US men’s size 7 or so.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Dee Bunderschaft

customer_reviews.title: Good, inexpensive gaiters
customer_reviews.text: These worked well for inexpensive gaiters. Kept to dust and grime out of my boots.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Alane

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on ~ using next week in the high Sierras.
customer_reviews.author: K. Boukas

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: Used these as we climbed to the summit of Mt. St. Helen's. Kept the ash and crushed pumice out. Held up and ready for the next hike!
customer_reviews.author: Longlegs

customer_reviews.title: Fake reviews
customer_reviews.text: Caution, most of the reviews for these gators are really for an umbrella and for felt pads for bottom of furniture legs.
customer_reviews.author: W. Dozier

product_meta.title: AKEfit Outdoor Waterproof Snow Leg Gaiters Hiking Walking Climbing Hunting Leggings Cover Leg Gaiters for Men and Women
